instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.ADAPTER_SENSE: What is ADAPTER_SENSE? This is a line between the onewire circuit and the magsafe charger where the magsafe charger can talk to the SMC(system management controller) on the SYS_ONEWIRE line..
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC: What is SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC? SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC is a voltage that is created if SMC_BC_ACOK & PP3V42_G3H are both present that powers the chipset for the onewire circuit that allows the SMC to talk to the charger on the SYS_ONEWIRE line. This is necessary for the magsafe charger to have a light on it. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.ADPATER_SENSE: What is ADPATER_SENSE? This is a typo of ADAPTER_SENSE When you see ADPATER_SENSE, assume they meant to type ADAPTER_SENSE.
definitions.SYS_ONEWIRE: What is SYS_ONEWIRE? This is a bidirectional communication line between the system management controller(SMC) and the charger that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC. This must be working for the light to come on on the magsafe charger. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dim green light on charger no powering up
threads.message:
i have board with was water damaged. replaced few components with was look bad but still no sign of life.:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> : 12.6v
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> :16.37v
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> :3.41v
<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC</SIGNAL>: 3.42v
<SIGNAL>ADAPTER_SENSE</SIGNAL>: 3.42v
any idea why light is so dim and no power up ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dim green light on charger no powering up
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dim green light on charger no powering up
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dim green light on charger no powering up
threads.message:
Why check <SIGNAL>SLP_S4</SIGNAL> when there is no green light? I'm sorry but stop giving advice when you still have to learn the basics.

STOP USING COMMENTS!

Green light is the first thing you need, tried a good magsafe board? Where was the corrosion?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dim green light on charger no powering up
threads.message: corrosion was next to lvds connector and i replaced for new one. i try 3 different magsafe boards but still no luck

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dim green light on charger no powering up
threads.message: That can also means there is corrosion somewhere on the one-wire circuit. Possibly crap under the DCIN connector J6900. Check <SIGNAL>ADPATER_SENSE</SIGNAL> voltage and trace.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dim green light on charger no powering up
threads.message: ok. i removed and clean dcin connector and bridged pin 5 dcin to <CHIP>U6900</CHIP> pin 5 and now i have green light on charger but when i connect 16.5v charger. when i connect 18.5v no green light :( very strange situation

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dim green light on charger no powering up
threads.message: What is voltage on <SIGNAL>ADAPTER_SENSE</SIGNAL> with the 18.5V charger?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dim green light on charger no powering up
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dim green light on charger no powering up
threads.message: Too low, something is dragging it down should be 3V42. Bad magsafe board, crap under the connector, bad <CHIP>U6900</CHIP>. I assume <SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL> stays at 3V42 always.
